skill.name: module-health
skill.description: Modular architecture health assessor for Logseq Template Graph. Analyzes module balance, cohesion, size distribution, and dependencies. Calculates health scores and suggests reorganization. Use when checking module structure, assessing architecture quality, or planning refactoring.
skill.summary: Modular architecture health assessor for Logseq Template Graph. Analyzes module balance, cohesion, s...
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate architecture analysis skill with low risk. The skill analyzes module structure in the source/ directory using file reading and counting operations. Helper scripts use standard utilities (grep, wc, bc) for text processing. No network calls, credential access, or dangerous execution patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Large EDN templates become hard to maintain. This skill calculates health scores for each module based on balance, cohesion, and documentation. It identifies bloated modules, suggests reorganization plans, and tracks architecture quality over time.
actual_capabilities: Calculate health scores for each module (0-100 scale)
Identify bloated modules (50+ classes) and small modules (under 5)
Analyze class-to-property ratios and documentation coverage
Generate reorganization plans with effort estimates
Track module growth trends over time via git history
Map module dependencies and detect coupling issues
limitations: Limited to Logseq Template Graph projects with source/ directory structure
Does not modify files or perform refactoring automatically
Health scores are guidelines, not absolute rules
Cannot analyze non-EDN projects or different module structures

use_cases.title: Evaluate module organization
use_cases.description: Run health checks before releases to ensure modules meet quality standards and identify refactoring needs

use_cases.title: Plan reorganization
use_cases.description: Get detailed analysis of mis/ module bloat with specific split strategies and time estimates

use_cases.title: Track architecture quality
use_cases.description: Monitor health scores over time to identify declining module quality and plan improvements

prompt_templates.title: Quick Health Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check module health and show me the overall health score, a summary table, and top issues

prompt_templates.title: Deep Module Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the misc/ module in detail and show me how to split it into focused modules

prompt_templates.title: Reorganization Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I reorganize my modules? Show me a step-by-step plan with commands and effort estimates

prompt_templates.title: Track Changes Over Time
prompt_templates.prompt: How have my modules changed over the last 90 days? Show growth trends and health score history

output: Top Priority: Split misc/ module into focused domains
Time estimate: 4-5 hours for complete reorganization

best_practices: Run health checks before major releases to catch architectural drift
Review health scores when adding new classes to existing modules
Use reorganization plans to break down large refactoring tasks
Track health scores over time to identify declining module quality early
anti_patterns: Adding new classes to misc/ instead of creating focused modules
Ignoring health scores below 60 - they indicate real maintainability issues
Splitting modules too aggressively (under 5 classes each)
Delaying reorganization - bloat compounds and becomes harder to fix

faq.question: Which projects work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Logseq Template Graph projects that have a source/ directory with modular EDN files.

faq.question: What does a health score measure?
faq.answer: Scores measure size balance, documentation quality, organization clarity, class-property ratio, and completeness (0-100 scale).

faq.question: Can the skill modify my files?
faq.answer: No. The skill analyzes and suggests but does not automatically refactor. You must approve and execute changes yourself.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads files in the source/ directory and outputs analysis. No data is sent anywhere.

faq.question: What if health score is low?
faq.answer: Low scores indicate issues like bloated modules or missing documentation. The skill provides specific recommendations and effort estimates to improve.

faq.question: How is this different from other code analyzers?
faq.answer: This is purpose-built for EDN template modular architecture, calculating scores specific to class-property organization patterns.
